lead_paragraph: A major survey of Americans struggling with medical bills finds that, even among the insured, illness and injury can reshape a family’s financial health.
snippet: A major survey of Americans struggling with medical bills finds that, even among the insured, illness and injury can reshape a family’s financial health.

headline.main: Even Insured Can Face Crushing Medical Debt, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Medical Debt Often Crushing Even for Insured

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

abstract: Survey of Americans grappling with steep medical bills shows having insurance often provides little protection from significant medical debt; poll shows 20 percent of people younger than 65 with health insurance reported trouble paying medical bills in 2015, compared with 53 percent of uninsured; numbers reflect high cost of health care in United States and limitations of Affordable Care Act.
